question-no-0.question: Did you hit, injure or fall on your upper arm or shoulder recently?

then.condition: Did you hit, injure or fall on your upper arm or shoulder recently?

conditions.condition: Did you hit, injure or fall on your upper arm or shoulder recently?

question-no-1.question: Did you feel your shoulder pop out of place and/or pop back into place?

then.assertation: Your SHOULDER may be or may have been DISLOCATED.
See your doctor right away.

else.condition: Did you feel your shoulder pop out of place and/or pop back into place?

conditions.condition: Did you feel your shoulder pop out of place and/or pop back into place?

question-no-2.question: Is your upper arm swollen or misshaped?

then.assertation: Your HUMERUS (upper arm bone) may be FRACTURED.
EMERGENCY Call your doctor or go to the emergency room right away.

else.condition: Is your upper arm swollen or misshaped?

conditions.condition: Is your upper arm swollen or misshaped?

question-no-3.question: Is your collarbone tender, or do you have a bump on it?

then.assertation: Your CLAVICLE (collarbone) may be FRACTURED.
Call your doctor right away. Use a sling to restrict movement of your arm and use an analgesic, such as acetaminophen or ibuprofen, to relieve pain until you see your doctor.

else.condition: Is your collarbone tender, or do you have a bump on it?

conditions.condition: Is your collarbone tender, or do you have a bump on it?

question-no-4.question: Is there tenderness or pain near the shoulder-end of your collarbone, and does lifting your arm with your uninjured arm help the pain?

then.assertation: Your SHOULDER may be SEPARATED.
Call your doctor right away. Use a sling to restrict movement of your arm and use an analgesic, such as acetaminophen or ibuprofen, to relieve pain until you see your doctor.

else.condition: Is there tenderness or pain near the shoulder-end of your collarbone, and does lifting your arm with your uninjured arm help the pain?

conditions.condition: Is there tenderness or pain near the shoulder-end of your collarbone, and does lifting your arm with your uninjured arm help the pain?

question-no-5.question: Does pain come with a twisting motion of your arm, or does a throwing motion cause pain, and does your shoulder seem weak?

then.assertation: You may have a TORN ROTATOR CUFF or SHOULDER INSTABILITY
See your doctor.

else.condition: Does pain come with a twisting motion of your arm, or does a throwing motion cause pain, and does your shoulder seem weak?

conditions.condition: Does pain come with a twisting motion of your arm, or does a throwing motion cause pain, and does your shoulder seem weak?

question-no-6.question: Do you have redness or swelling around your shoulder?

then.assertation: You may have INFLAMMATION in or around a joint, also called BURSITIS, or a serious INFECTION of the bone, the joint, or the skin.
URGENT See your doctor right away.

else.condition: Do you have redness or swelling around your shoulder?

conditions.condition: Do you have redness or swelling around your shoulder?

question-no-7.question: Within the last month have you had a sore throat or a skin ?

then.assertation: These symptoms may be from RHEUMATIC FEVER, a reaction to a
URGENT See your doctor right away.

else.condition: Within the last month have you had a sore throat or a skin ?

conditions.condition: Within the last month have you had a sore throat or a skin ?

question-no-8.question: Do you have redness and swelling in more than one joint, including your shoulder?

then.assertation: You may have RHEUMATOID ARTHRITIS, a disease affecting the immune system, or GOUT, an inflammation of the shoulder joint.
See your doctor. Apply heat to the affected area and take an anti-inflammatory medicine, such as ibuprofen, for pain.

else.condition: Do you have redness and swelling in more than one joint, including your shoulder?

conditions.condition: Do you have redness and swelling in more than one joint, including your shoulder?

question-no-9.question: Do you feel pain when you move your shoulder but there's no swelling or redness?

then.assertation: You may have BURSITIS or ROTATOR CUFF SYNDROME
Use an anti-inflammatory medicine, such as ibuprofen, and apply heat to the affected area. If your symptoms do not improve, see your doctor.

else.condition: Do you feel pain when you move your shoulder but there's no swelling or redness?

conditions.condition: Do you feel pain when you move your shoulder but there's no swelling or redness?

question-no-10.question: Do you have increasing stiffness and inability to move your shoulder ?

then.assertation: You may have ADHESIVE CAPSULITIS, also called a FROZEN SHOULDER.
See your doctor. This condition is usually treated with special exercises you can do on your own.

else.assertation: For more information, please talk to your doctor. If you think the problem is serious, call your doctor right away.
